summary: Worked with clients and prospects to gather requirements and design solutions.
Designed and implemented custom web applications.
Created web services to work with internal data.
Deployed applications on AWS ECS via CDK.
Developed native and cross platform mobile apps.
Led teams of up to 7 developers per project.
Tuned apps to reduce CPU usage by up to 80%.
Worked with stakeholders to develop requirements and specifications.
Designed MySQL DB to store content and updates.
Managed 10 member agile development team responsible for mobile, web and data products.
IT staff grew from 5 to 20+ members.
Performed maintenance and development for the OS/390 C/C++ run-time library and common components.
Created unit test cases to reproduce failures.
Diagnosed bugs via debugger and heap analysis.
Developed fixes using C, PL/X and Assembly.

projects.title: Portfolio Website
projects.subtitle: React Single Page Application
detail: I built this using React and TypeScript to host my resume and portfolio. In order to keep this as light weight as possible so in addition to React, it's only using React Router for navigation and DOMPurify to make sure I don't inject any bad markup from my JSON data.
The portfolio page is filterable by skill. I used the built-in reducer functionality in React for the filtering rather than adding Redux or other state-management libraries to the project.
The CSS is hand-coded (no SASS) and I used flexbox layout to make it responsive. I used Vite as the build system and ViTest for unit tests.
It's hosted on GitHub pages. Feel free to fork it to host you're own resume!

projects.title: Vehicle Telematics Prototype
projects.subtitle: IoT Firmware
summary: Uses nRF9160 SOC and Zephyr RTOS
Logs to web service via LTE cellular
detail: This project is a proof-of-concept for an embedded vehicle telematics solution. It's developed for the Nordic Semiconductor nRF9160 SoC and supports reading CAN-BUS data and logging to a web service.
For development hardware, I'm using the nRF9160 DK development board with a DFRobot CAN-BUS shield.
The project is running on Zephyr RTOS and developed using the nRFConnect SDK.

projects.title: Electronics Manufacturer Website
projects.subtitle: Jahia CMS with React UI and AWS API
summary: Node web services hosted on AWS
detail: I was the Architect and lead developer on this project. We were contracted by a major electronics component manufacturer to build a redesigned website on the Jahia CMS. As part of the redesign we would also take also over maintenance and hosting of a back-office Node + React apps used to maintain product data.
While also attending working meetings between the client and the design firm, I developed the new hosting architecture for their existing back-end applications.

Many of the Node libraries used in these applications (including React and Node itself) were were several years out of date and needed to be updated for security fixes. Once this was complete, the applications were bundled as Docker images for deployment on ECS.

MongoDB and MS SQL databases were migrated to Amazon DocumentDB and RDS for MySQL. I used the AWS CDK to specify the deployment stacks as TypeScript code. The resulting CDK code was then to bootstrap development, test, and production AWS accounts.

Once the designs were completed, I used them to specify a set of CMS modules for the implementation team. These modules included a standardized set of content components for building pages, as well as JavaScript components. An integration module was specified to map product data from the back-end system now running on AWS to CMS content nodes.

A primary piece of functionality on the site was an parametric product search application implemented with React. State management was handled using Redux and Immer, and data was provided by the (migrated) back-end applications via the CMS integration.

Each module was created as a separate Git repo with documentation and configured in the GitLab CI/CD system. These modules were then implemented by the team and myself. I was also responsible for code reviews and deployment.
Once the new site functionality was complete. I developed a JavaScript tool using fast-xml-parser to transform important content (news and press sections) from the old site for the new.

projects.title: Entertainment Company Website
projects.subtitle: Drupal CMS with React
detail: I was the Architect and lead developer on this project. An entertainment company with over 300 physical locations contracted us to develop an newly redesigned website which would include eCommerce functionality for booking events at their properties.
During the proposal process, we evaluated several CMS platforms for the project. Based on the client's familiarity with Drupal on their existing site, it was chosen for the new site.

I worked on-site and remotely with the design agency contracted with the client during development of the new online booking flow. My role during this time was to ensure minimal friction between the UX design and the technical implementation.
The final designs were used to specify a set of reusable content components, and React applications to handle the eCommerce functionality.

The React application loaded data from the client's CRM system and used Redux and Immer to maintain customer order state in a multi-step booking wizard. Both credit card and Apple Pay were supported as payment methods.

After the design phase, I served as lead developer. In this role I was responsible for configuring the CI/CD system to perform automatic testing an deployment to the client's Acquia hosting environment. In addition to my own development tasks, I also maintained the code base and was responsible for approving merge requests from the other team members.
After launching the site, I continued as the lead developer performing maintenance and enhancements for several years.

projects.title: Website Data Conversion
projects.subtitle: Javascript ETL
detail: A client needed to migrate several hundred pages from a production CMS site to a newly redesigned site. To accomplish this I exported the content as XML and then wrote some NodeJS transformation programs to extract data from the old site and convert it to use the newly designed theme.

The transforms were handled by converting the exported XML to JavaScript objects using fast-xml-parser. These objects were then transformed to match the required structure for the new site and written out to the proper compressed XML format for import using JSZip.
The program was also responsible for downloading all the image files from the old site and bundling them for import to the new site.

projects.title: Customer Service App
projects.subtitle: Porting iOS App to Flutter
summary: Ported from native iOS to Flutter
detail: A customer required assistance in porting a native iOS application written in Swift to Flutter. I worked on user preferences, account switching, and password reset.
The client's REST API was used via standard HTTP calls. Data was stored in using the flutter_secure_storage API and cleared when logging out or switching accounts.

projects.title: Investment Portfolio Dashboard
projects.subtitle: Java & JavaScript Web Application
detail: I was assigned to assist a client in implementing new features on an investment account dashboard web application for retirement accounts. The application was written Java using the Spring application framework.

I was responsible for implementing portfolio summary charts. For this, the data was retrieved by an Java (Spring) service class from a SOAP webservice authenticated using OAuth and then displayed in the browser using Chart.js.

projects.title: Hotel Chain Website
projects.subtitle: Jahia CMS
summary: Integrated client API for property data
detail: We were contracted to develop a new website for a hotel management company. As a full stack developer on this project, I was assigned to implement property search and pricing functionality in the Jahia CMS and JavaScript UI.

I wrote a CMS module in Java to interface with the client's property management webservice to retrieve pricing and room availability data. Additional data including location and amenities was stored in the CMS. Data from the two sources was merged in a Java Service class and exposed via REST endpoint.
Based on a provided mockup from our designer, I implemented the front JavaScript using jQuery and Bootstrap to allow users to search available rooms by price, location, and amenities.

projects.title: DNS Registration Website
projects.subtitle: Umbraco CMS
detail: I was the Architect and lead developer on this project. We were contracted to develop a domain search and registration website for a new top level domain. The Umbraco CMS was used for site content and a separate .NET application was developed to support the eCommerce functionality for searching for and purchasing domain registrations. The site was deployed on Azure and used Azure AD for user authentication.

My responsibilities on this project included specifying and assigning work items to the team, configuring CI/CD, and reviewing committed code. During implementation I was responsible for configuring and customizing the CMS as well as general development tasks.

projects.title: Image Map Generator
projects.subtitle: Java Library and Web Components
summary: Java library for single use image maps
detail: A client contracted us to implement a library for generating single-use image maps for their web products. As the sole software engineer assigned to this project. I developed the library as a Spring Boot project that could be integrated with the client's applications.

Apache Batik was used to assemble a randomized SVG image on the server which was then cached using Ehcache. This was then served via a Spring REST web service to an HTML + JavaScript front end library. The front end code could use SVG for the image map if it was supported by the browser or fall back to JPG if not. The application was themeable using SVG template files configured in the Spring context configuration.

projects.title: Medical Application Review
projects.subtitle: Software Analysis and Report
detail: A hospital hired us to review an internal decision support application prior to possibly licensing it to other institutions. I was the architect assigned to this project.

The review process included interviews with the development team, institution staff and users. The code was also reviewed manually and using the SonarQube static analysis package. I prepared a report for the customer that covered; security (OWASP Top 10), software used and licensing, hardware requirements, development lifecycle, source code quality, HIPAA compliance, and database design. The report also included recommended software and process changes to be implemented prior to licensing of the project.

projects.title: Government Grant Website
projects.subtitle: Rails Web Application
detail: A startup contracted us to develop a Ruby on Rails web application to assist with applying for U.S. government grants. I was a software engineer assigned to this project.
The application used data from SBIR.gov and allowed users to search and save available grants and track their steps in the grant application process.

projects.title: College Application Website
projects.subtitle: Rails Web Application
detail: A startup contracted us to develop a Ruby on Rails web application to help students navigate the college application and financial aid process. I was a software engineer assigned to this project.
Users could bookmark favorite colleges and complete a checklist of application steps. The application would send email reminders for each step in the process.

projects.title: Digital Asset Manager
projects.subtitle: Java & GTW Web Application
detail: I was contracted as a Software Engineer to assist the development of an in-house digital asset management application at a large greeting-card. In this role I worked with the client's IT staff and other contractors.

The application was written in Java using Spring Framework and the GWT UI toolkit. Data was stored in MS SQL with ORM via Hibernate. The data was also synced with the client's SAP CRM to relate assets to product SKUs in which they were used and other data.

projects.title: Charm Quark
projects.subtitle: iOS Puzzle Game
summary: Designed and coded iOS puzzle game.
Hosted site on Google Cloud Platform.
Published application to Apple App Store.
detail: Charm Quark is an iOS puzzle game. The goal is to match 5 particles of the same color and rather than moving next piece like in Tetris the whole play-field rotates. I wrote this game around the time the Large Hadron Collider was in the news, so I decided to use that as my inspiration for the graphics.

The game is written in Objective-C using the Cocos2D game library. Sprites were created as SVG using Inkscape. Music was composed with GarageBand. The website for this app (no longer available) was written in Python and hosted on Google App Engine

The app was published in the Apple App Store in 2012. It's no longer available on the app store because the audio library in use was removed from iOS by Apple. I've uploaded the source code to GitHub under the MIT license.

projects.title: Drug Reference Apps
projects.subtitle: Native Mobile Apps (Multiple Platforms)
detail: As a software engineer at Lexi-Comp, I was the designer and initial developer for their mobile pharmacology applications. The first versions written were for PalmOS and developed using PocketPC (later renamed Windows Mobile), BlackBerry, iOS, Android and Palm WebOS.

The initial project on PalmOS was probably the most challenging. The PalmOS PDB file format was simply sequential records of up to 64k each. There was no HTML component for rendering hypertext content for the data. To work around these limitations, I developed a binary hypertext format and used a slightly modified version of zlib to compress multiple documents into a single PDB record. I also developed a downloader application in Java to keep the database files up to date and sync them to the device. Also during this project, I contributed a patch to the Linux kernel USB driver to recognize the device ID of the memory stick reader in the Sony Clié.

After PalmOS, the next platform I implemented was Windows Mobile (then known as Pocket PC). This platform had a subset of the Windows API and HTML rendering so was a bit easier than PalmOS. I reused the server code, zlib compression, and downloader application but with a more advanced file format.

In 2007 when Apple launched the iPhone we set about porting the application so we could have it on the App Store as soon as possible. We later added dedicated iPad support. This platform was yet easier to implement on due to a more advanced OS and built-in WebKit HTML and JavaScript engine and SQLite database format. Android and Blackberry followed also using SQLite.
In 2010, I was promoted to Manager of Software Product Development, where I led the team responsible for the company's mobile, web and data products.

projects.title: Pharmacology Data Management System
projects.subtitle: Java / Swing Application
detail: As a software engineer at Lexi-Comp I contributed to the development of their in-house content management system.

This application was written in Java with a Swing UI and hosted on Linux with Apache and Tomcat. The system used Oracle as a master database with MySQL set up as read-only replicas for web and mobile use.
I was responsible for the initial implementation of the WYSIWYG XML editor, XML to HTML transformation, and MySQL database design.
In 2010, I was promoted to Manager of Software Product Development, where I led the team responsible for the company's mobile, web and data products.
